alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Webster, northern Jackson, southern Claiborne, northeastern Bienville and Lincoln Parishes through 1215 AM CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Doyline to 7 miles north of Arcadia. Movement was east southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Minden, Grambling, Arcadia, Sibley, Gibsland, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Dubach, Choudrant, Simsboro, Vienna, Athens, Bienville, Bryceland, Mount Lebanon, Mount Zion, Aycock, Gilark and Corinth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.
